elements.title: Vicky López (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vicky López (pictured) took up horse riding during a six-month period when she was not allowed to play football?

elements.title: Pink Venom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Blackpink's "Pink Venom" incorporates the sounds of traditional Korean instruments such as the geomungo?

elements.title: Iona Allen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Iona Allen, "the only one to ever make a perfect pair of boots", constructed the pair worn by Neil Armstrong on the Moon out of thirteen layers of precisely fabricated material?

elements.title: Vostok 2022 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vostok 2022 marked the most comprehensive participation of Chinese forces in a Russian military exercise to date?

elements.title: Chandelure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the chandelier Pokémon Chandelure is a playable character in the fighting game Pokkén Tournament?

elements.title: REM de l'Est (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the REM de l'Est, a planned light rail network, was abandoned due to its controversial use of elevated railways in downtown Montreal?

elements.title: Virtual Self (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Porter Robinson listened to excerpts of 100,000 songs in two years to create his EP Virtual Self?

elements.title: tokoyama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that tokoyama (traditional Japanese hairdressers) working in kabuki are divided into specialties named after the floors of the Kabuki-za?

elements.title: Puyallup people (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Puyallup people traditionally took ritual sweat baths before hunting, after intercourse, and even as a sport?
